website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for cutting guitar and other instrument strings and for smaller jobs.
pros: Self-adjusting clamps hold the wire perpendicular to the jaws, making this a great tool for precision use on smaller projects
cons: Not suited for thick wires, and trying to use this tool for that purpose will likely damage it

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: I've only just received these so time will tell on durability and versatility. But the reason I bought them is for cutting remembrance wire (stainless steel, larger Guage, memory wire) and that much they do miraculously well! Ive struggled so much with the remembrance that i finally gave in and bought these at average retail price. They cut through it like it's a twig of asparagus easily with a little snap. I hope these will make my other projects using larger Guage wire significantly easier.
customer_reviews.author: LongHairedHippie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty product
customer_reviews.text: This product cuts flush on both sides without failure. Several hundred cuts on 16g steel wire and hasnt lost its edge. It is worth the extra money to pick one of these up. I will only use this product for all my cutting needs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not deform the wire
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cutter because it has a different cut than the average wire cutter. The wire isn't deformed when its cut, unlike the typical wire cutter which bites it with two straight cutters. This one shears the wire with two hemispherical blades, leaving a round cut. If you need to place the wire into a round connector, this cutter does the trick. I use it on heavy gauge (10 and 12) wire.
customer_reviews.author: EastMemphis

customer_reviews.title: Cut safely
customer_reviews.text: THE best tool for music wire I have found in 50 yrs. modeling. If you plan to use music wire for strength, then do yourself a favor and buy one of these. We all know the Xuron brand.
customer_reviews.author: Train Chaser

customer_reviews.title: Not for stranded wire, perfect for the hard stuff
customer_reviews.text: Good quality cuts on hard, solid core wires. Now I can stop ruining my electrical wire cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gatliff

customer_reviews.title: They seem up to the task...
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind that these are NOT flush cutters. If you need a flush cut, keep looking. OTOH, if you need to cut hard or music wire, these are pretty good. Though I prefer my CruzTools String cutter for guitar strings as I can get closer to the locking tuners with those. On the plus side, they're relatively light weight and easy on your hands. They don't have the heft of Swanstrom, but they're also a whole lot less. They do seem to make a nice clean cut though.
customer_reviews.author: G. WagstaffTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Cutting steel wire. Very easy to use. One end is perfectly flat -- just flip and trim to get 2 flat ends. I like the way it solidly holds the wire stationary while you cut. Longevity unknown at this time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Strong, well made product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a different set from an unknown manufacturer that turned out to be not what I was hoping for. This product worked great to cut the strings off an old 1902 upgrade cabinet grande (I know it is only marketing, but it is the taller upright non the less), and there were no issues with any of those string sizes (up to size 19 wires). I would recommend this product for cutting, but for getting in super tight for the cleanest possible finish (for restringing per se), I would probably recommend the exceedingly expensive Starrett cutters. They are the best money can buy, but unnecessary for what I was using them for.
customer_reviews.author: CalGuY

customer_reviews.title: These are the best wire and guitar string cutters on the market, by far!
customer_reviews.text: By far, the best wire cutters for the gauge I was looking for: 0.40-.080 - cuts clean like butter. No other wire cutters have fit or felt like this, nor have they left such a perfectly symmetrical shear. They are the best you can get, and I’ve looked and tried.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: A specialized tool for cutting hard or tough wire
customer_reviews.text: This shear is specifically designed to cut music wire and other hard or tough wire up to 0.060" (1.5mm) in diameter. I got it for cutting some 0.013" nylon coated stranded stainless steel miniature cable. I needed a clean, staight cut and this tool did the job. As with any tool, don't use this for material for which it isn't designed. Music wire or stainless steel is fine; hardened tool steel, for example, would probably damage the tool.
customer_reviews.author: BillH

customer_reviews.title: Works well for guitar strings
customer_reviews.text: These cutters arrived very quickly. Unlike one of the Q&As I found they worked well on guitar strings. Only issue you might have is they’re not flush cluttered. Always leave a maybe 4 mm of string sticking out of the peg.
customer_reviews.author: Andy S

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers
customer_reviews.text: This is the only pliers that I ever seen that cuts the wire flush. Most pliers leave the wired with an end that needs to be ground flush. Not with these, saves a lot of time
customer_reviews.author: greenrock

customer_reviews.title: What you need for cutting square ends in hard wire.
customer_reviews.text: Typical side cutters crush hard wire cuts and if you are not careful, the cutter themselves. This cutter uses a shearing action to make the cut and the end is square. Well worth the money and you need more than one.
customer_reviews.author: James Main

customer_reviews.title: 2193F is the best of Music Wire Cutter
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for delivering faster than scheduled delivery date. 2193F is the best of Music Wire Cutter. No grip force required, excellent sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: 3above

customer_reviews.title: Got what I paid for
customer_reviews.text: It is pricey but surely worth the money. Makes very clean cut to make it easy to solder both ends together. It is the one of kinds that you don't want to get cheap imported one.
customer_reviews.author: vill klinton

customer_reviews.title: These work like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: How did I get buy with out these for so long!
customer_reviews.author: B. D.

customer_reviews.title: A very well  made tool
customer_reviews.text: I got this cutter to create tiny rivets out of copper wire for plugging thermal vias under chips on printed circuit boards. I needed a method of cutting the wire square, and this does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: PaulW

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done
customer_reviews.text: The cutters are very sturdy and cut piano wire cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark and Avalon Gietz

customer_reviews.title: Do what they are supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for deconstructing a piano. I was extremely leery of cutting piano wire at first, but after the first few snips-and getting used to the sparks created - it was no big deal. These cut through the wire with very little effort. Not totally sure I will ever have any use for them again, but I highly recommend them to anyone who needs to cut piano wire.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Xuron wire shear
customer_reviews.text: I got this to cut the ends off strings for guitars and violins, so far it's worked great. Can't say how it will hold up,but it looks like it should do well
customer_reviews.author: magic sam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. Someone took it now I have to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: A Shagonaby

customer_reviews.title: They look good for cutting straight wire...
customer_reviews.text: but I don't cut straight wire much, I cut coils....so, I have yet to find a use for them....but they do look good at what they do....the picture didn't show me the head properly, or I wouldn't have got them...
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Thorazine

customer_reviews.title: i thought it would be bigger. I thought I ...
customer_reviews.text: i thought it would be bigger. I thought I was ordering a more substantial tool, this one is not any bigger than my regular jewelry making tools. I already had a wire cutter this size, I was trying to find a stronger one that could cut piano wire. I will give it a try, but I don't think it is going to last.
customer_reviews.author: Beatrice Potter

customer_reviews.title: These were terrible, I got them because it said you could ...
customer_reviews.text: These were terrible, I got them because it said you could cut music wire with them. I got it to cut guitar strings. It wouldn't cut any of them, all it did was make little right angles on them. What a waste of money, I've had plenty of their shears and those are great, but these just didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbrown2056

customer_reviews.title: A Unique And Perfect Tool
customer_reviews.text: It's ingenious how on both sides the wire is clamped perfectly square by little guides before the cleaving jaws in the middle do the hard work. Very easy on your hands. Currently I'm using it to cleave No.14 aluminum nail heads off so I can use the shafts as cheap aluminum rods. They work ideally with very hard music wire too even in an extended period production environment used by a dainty assistant who isn't the usual muscular handyman.
customer_reviews.author: Nik Willmore

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these to cut .062" music wire and they work great. Minimal pressure is required and the cuts are square and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Reyna

product_meta.title: Xuron - Xuron - 2193F Music Wire Shear, Lead Retainer - 2193F
product_meta.description:
The Xuron 2193F hard and music wire cutter cuts hard wires size 15 to 29 and music wire up to 0.060". Self-adjusting clamps hold the wire perpendicular to the jaws, producing a square cut on both sides of the cut wire. The cutter is designed for use on hard wire including stainless steel, spring, piano, nichrome, gold, electrical, copper, and annealed wire; and music wire up to 0.060".

 Xuron Corp. manufactures precision hand tools such as wire cutters and strippers, scissors, and pliers for electronics, aerospace, plastic molding, wire processing, hobby, craft, jewelry, and fishing industries. The company, headquartered in Saco, Maine, was founded in 1971.
feature_bullets: Project type: Jewelry Manufacturing, Electronics, Electrical

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
